net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context

Class SingleBindingContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context.SingleBindingContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BindingContext
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleBindingVariableContext

    public class SingleBindingContext
extends Object
implements BindingContext

    A binding context that binds a single variable to an expression.

    A single-variable binding context consists of an expression representing a single variable name and a bound value, plus a reference to an enclosing context that may contain further bindings.

    This binding context is used to bind the index variable of a forach block in the instance compiler, or to bind values to EFA variable in the EFA compiler.

    Author:
    Robi Malik
    See Also:
    BindingContext

    • Method Detail

      • getBoundExpression

        public SimpleExpressionProxy getBoundExpression(SimpleExpressionProxy ident)
        Description copied from interface: BindingContext
        Gets the value bound to the given name.
        Specified by:
        getBoundExpression in interface BindingContext
        Parameters:
        ident - The name to be looked up. It can be identifier, simple or indexed, (to support array lookups), or a unary expression (to support next-state value of EFA variables.
        Returns:
        A variable-free expression representing the concrete value bound to the given name in this context, or null if there is no binding for the given name.
